author: Marta MenÃ©ndez
title: El plan solidario que ha unido a MartÃ­nez-Almeida y Feliciano LÃ³pez
text: El plan solidario que ha unido a JosÃ© Luis MartÃ­nez-Almeida, Feliciano LÃ³pez y Luis Figo La XXIII ediciÃ³n del torneo benÃ©fico contra el cÃ¡ncer de mama ha contado con numerosas personalidades Desde JosÃ© Luis MartÃ­nez-Almeida o Esperanza Aguirre, hasta Luis Figo o Feliciano LÃ³pez Esta no es la primera vez que el alcalde de Madrid se deja ver practicando golf La XXIII ediciÃ³n del torneo benÃ©fico contra el cÃ¡ncer de mama, programada para este 19 de septiembre en el Campo de Golf La HerrerÃ­a, en El Escorial, ha reunido a numerosas personalidades, entre las que destacan figuras del deporte y la polÃ­tica en EspaÃ±a tales como Luis Figo, PepÃ­n Liria, Bernardo Schuster, la ex presidenta del Senado y de la Comunidad de Madrid Esperanza Aguirre, Feliciano LÃ³pez o [JosÃ© Luis MartÃ­nez-Almeida](https://okdiario.com/look/actualidad/jose-luis-martinez-almeida-planes-hijos-terea-urquijo-2060911), entre otros. [el actual director de las Finales de la Copa Davis de MÃ¡laga.](https://okdiario.com/look/actualidad/feliciano-lopez-mas-alla-pistas-promotor-del-mutua-madrid-open-padre-dos-hijos-matrimonio-estable-2009272)El ex de Alba Carrillo ha llegado al encuentro muy sonriente, ataviado con un polo de color azul marino con detalles de ribetes, pantalones de color gris claro ajustados al cuerpo y unas zapatillas deportivas blancas. Tras Ã©l ha hecho lo propio Luis Figo. JosÃ© Luis MartÃ­nez-Almeida, Feliciano LÃ³pez y Luis Figo en un acto solidario. (Foto: Gtres) Un poco mÃ¡s tarde ha llegado JosÃ© Luis MartÃ­nez-Almeida, que se ha dejado ver, primero montado en el clÃ¡sico carrito de golf junto a Esperanza Aguirre, y despuÃ©s efectÃºando un golpe en el green con el objetivo de embocar la bola. El alcalde de Madrid ha exhibido su destreza con este deporte que ya le hemos visto practicar en mÃ¡s de una ocasiÃ³n. El pasado mes de julio, sin ir mÃ¡s lejos, [MartÃ­nez-Almeida participÃ³ en el IV Trofeo Ciudades Madrid-Motril de golf](https://okdiario.com/look/actualidad/album-privado-vacaciones-jose-luis-martinez-almeida-teresa-urquijo-2097831), que se celebrÃ³ en el campo Los Moriscos de Granada. Lo hizo junto a su esposa, Teresa Urquijo, que recibiÃ³ un premio de la organizaciÃ³n por su Â«brillante torneoÂ». La hija de Lucas Urquijo FernÃ¡ndez de Araoz y Beatriz Moreno y de BorbÃ³n logrÃ³ posicionarse entre las primeras en la clasificaciÃ³n femenina, destacando tambiÃ©n en la modalidad combinada, que suma los resultados en distintas categorÃ­as. Sea como fuere, lo cierto es que la presencia de JosÃ© Luis MartÃ­nez-Almeida en la XXIII ediciÃ³n del torneo benÃ©fico contra el cÃ¡ncer de mama ha servido para que el madrileÃ±o muestre su lado mÃ¡s solidario. Antes de desplazarse hasta El Escorial, MartÃ­nez-Almeida ha cumplido con varios compromisos profesionales, como la inauguraciÃ³n de la IV ediciÃ³n del Congreso smart city de la Red EspaÃ±ola de Ciudades Inteligentes (RECI) o la exposiciÃ³n Setenta grandes maestros de la ColecciÃ³n PÃ©rez SimÃ³n. El alcalde tambiÃ©n ha presidido la reuniÃ³n de la Junta de Gobierno de la ciudad de Madrid. MartÃ­nez-Almeida y Esperanza Aguirre en un acto solidario. (Foto: Gtres) El evento ha sido organizado por el Doctor Ãngel MartÃ­n, presidente y fundador de la FundaciÃ³n ClÃ­nica Menorca y los fondos recaudados se destinarÃ¡n a la FundaciÃ³n La Vida en Rosa fundada en 2017 por la Dra. LucÃ­a GonzÃ¡lez Cortijo, jefa del Servicio de OncologÃ­a MÃ©dica del Hospital Universitario QuirÃ³n Salud y considerada entre los 10 mejores oncÃ³logos de nuestro paÃ­s.

author: @eldeber
title: Transportistas determinan paro indefinido desde el lunes para exigir la suba del pasaje de micros
text:
Transportistas determinan paro indefinido desde el lunes para exigir la suba del pasaje de micros
La medida fue asumida este sÃ¡bado en un cabildo. Exigen una tarifa transitoria de Bs 2,50. La AlcaldÃ­a ratifica que el pasaje se mantiene en Bs 2
El cabildo del transporte urbano sindicalizado y federado, realizado este sÃ¡bado, determinÃ³ paralizar el servicio de micros desde el prÃ³ximo lunes para exigir incremento en la tarifa a Bs 2,50.
El dirigente del sector, Segundo Ricalde, seÃ±alÃ³ que la medida se tomÃ³ ante la ne
gativa del Concejo Municipal de dar luz verde a una tarifa transitoria, como solicitaron."El cabildo lo ha decidido y se confirma el paro indefinido", seÃ±alÃ³ Ricalde.
La medida genera incertidumbre entre la poblaciÃ³n por las dificultades para transportarse que traerÃ¡ el paro.
Durante el cabildo, Ãngel Canaviri, ejecutivo de transporte interprovincial, pidiÃ³ a los transportistas estar atentos a las instructivas de los dirigentes para apoyar con bloqueos si las autoridades si no hay un incremento en el pasaje.
Desde la AlcaldÃ­a, se indicÃ³ que aÃºn no se ha autorizado ningÃºn ajuste tarifario, por lo que el pasaje se mantiene en Bs 2.
"El pasaje de dos bolivianos se tiene que mantener y este Concejo Municipal no va a dar el brazo a torcer y les pedimos a los ciudadanos que puedan resistir y que hagan respetar sus derechos de pagar los Bs 2 que corresponden", seÃ±alÃ³ la presidenta del Concejo, Silvana Mucarzel.

author: VNExplorer
title: â€˜Congress not known forâ€¦': KTR slams Siddaramaiah on Hijab row in Karnataka
text:
â€˜Congress not known forâ€¦â€™: KTR slams Siddaramaiah on Hijab row in Karnataka
Former Telangana minister and Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) working president K Taraka Ramarao has slammed Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah for taking a â€˜U-turnâ€™ on the hijab row. He said that the Congress party is known for breaking promises after coming to power.
When asked about his reaction to the lifting of the â€œbanâ€ on hijab at Karnataka educational institutions, KTR said, â€œNo, they have not lifted the ban yet. The Karnataka CM said that he is still thinking about it. This is what the Congress is popular for. Making promises before the elections and then breaking them by not fulfilling them. Not just in Karnataka, but it has been happening in Telangana as well.â€
Speaking at an event in Mysuru on Friday, Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah said, â€œWe will be withdrawing the ban on hijab which was imposed by the previous BJP government. I have directed the officials on the same and an official order will come soon regarding it. What to wear and what to eat is a personal choice. Why should the government obstruct such issues? Wear what you want and eat what you feel like.â€
However, on Saturday, Siddaramaiah clarified that the ban has not been lifted yet. â€œWe have not lifted the ban yet. We are thinking about it. After speaking to experts, we will take a call,â€ he added.
The hijab controversy first erupted in January last year when six students of the Government Pre-University (PU) College in Udupi accused the instituteâ€™s administration of not allowing them to enter the premises with their hijab on. The Muslim girls protested outside the institute after being denied entry.
In response, several Hindu students started attending classes wearing saffron shawls in several educational institutions.
On March 15 last year, the Karnataka high court declared that wearing the hijab was not mandatory in Islam and upheld the executive order. The students have moved the Supreme Court.
Read more news like this on HindustanTimes.com

author: Alek LaShomb
title: Imported flower bulbs from Europe take tariff hit
text:
AU SABLE FORKS, N.Y. (WCAX) â€“ The blooming tulips and lilies may smell good right now, but the prices for those and other flowers may soon stink. Flower wholesalers in the Adirondack region are among those in the industry who say Trump administration tariffs are adding more than 13 percent in added costs for bulb imports.
Linda Dâ€™Arco, the owner of Ampersand Bulb Company in Au Sable Forks, points to dozens of crates sourced directly from the Netherlands. She says bulbs from the country make up roughly 98 percent of their inventory during the summer and fall months. However, a blanket 10 percent tariff on imports to the United States is uprooting her blooming business.
â€œRight now, we should be ordering bulbs for delivery next January. We arenâ€™t. Not quite sure what the interest will be from our customers because the market is so volatile,â€ Dâ€™Arco said.
Already, she says the tariffs are doubling their fees at customs, with price hikes expected to reflect in the next few months. â€œThe consumer is going to be feeling those shortly. The first price hikes of cut flowers will be happening this summer as the summerâ€™s crops of lilies start to bloom.â€
Dâ€™Arco says the higher costs have already translated into fewer sales, forcing her to make pay cuts and avoid bringing in part-time help this summer. â€œI donâ€™t see this is much sustainable than half a year or a full year,â€ she said. â€œIt would just be so nice to have stability again, to know what is coming and to plan for that, and we just donâ€™t have that right now.â€

author: Michael Gasparino
title: OLLI Receives Largest-Ever Individual Member Gift - SBU News
text: The [Osher Lifelong Learning Institute (OLLI) at Stony Brook University](https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/olli/) recently received its largest individual member gift ever, from longtime member Robert Lang. This is the largest single gift beyond the originating endowments received from The Bernard Osher Foundation in 2007. OLLI at SBU is one of 125 Osher Institutes in the United States, all made possible by generous grants and endowments from The Bernard Osher Foundation. Lang, who passed away in 2022, was an OLLI member for five years and named the OLLI program as a beneficiary of his retirement plan. OLLI at SBU is a volunteer-based program that offers noncredit workshops, lectures, social events and day trips designed to appeal to those 50+ years of age. According to Liz Wilson, interim director of OLLI, itâ€™s designed to promote and support lifelong learning through programming of interest. Members are encouraged to join committees to help lead the program. â€œWe currently have more than 750 active volunteer members,â€ Wilson said. â€œThe OLLI curriculum is developed and curated by OLLI members for OLLI members.â€ â€œItâ€™s because of thoughtful and engaged members like Bob that the OLLI program is so successful,â€ said Peter Diplock, vice provost for continuing, professional, and executive education. â€œHe was an important member of OLLI, and we are grateful for his support, which will help ensure that the program will continue to thrive in the future.â€ Diplock said Langâ€™s gift will be impactful in providing scholarships and broadening membership access to new members who may not have the resources to join. In addition, the funds will help support OLLI community events that promote and celebrate a culture of intergenerational and lifelong learning. [Read the full story](https://sbmatters.stonybrook.edu/olli-receives-largest-individual-member-gift-from-late-member-robert-lang/) at SB Matters.

text:
